item.title: Some quotes from "The Technological Society" (1954)
item.description: Do you remember this scene from Metropolis? It is famous for the explosion that happens shortly the above clip. The young protagonist Freder has a vision of a ravenous machine-god eating ranks of proletariat workers. “Moloch!” he cries, and faints. But until the explosion occurs, the machine runs flawlessly. Look at it: its operators Technique transforms everything it touches into a machine. — p.4 Why should we pay attention to what Ellul wrote over 60 years ago?
